properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 3 at 8:56AM CST by NWS North Platte NE
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Nebraska...
North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and Keith
Counties.

.Minor flooding will continue along the North Platte River at Lewellen
through early next week. This minor flooding is due to ice
jams on the river. Fluctuations of a foot are possible with the
ice jam as ice breaks up during the day and refreezes at night.

The Flood Warning continues for
The North Platte River at Lewellen.
* until further notice.
* At  6:45 AM Friday the stage was 8.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 8.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will remain near 8.5 feet today then
fall to 8.1 feet by Saturday morning, and remain steady through
early next week.
* Impact...At 9.0 feet...Moderate flood stage. Flooding may occur
around Fairground Street, County Road 46, County Road 199 A and
County Road 44 A east of Highway 26. Homes near and along the river
may begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive your vehicle into areas where water covers the roadway.
The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely
and the road beneath may not be intact. Vehicles caught in rising
waters should be abandoned quickly.
